name: Kubernetes
description: Kubernetes dashboards provided by Sumo Logic.

children.name: Kubernetes - Cluster
children.description: The Kubernetes - Cluster dashboard provides a detailed view of the cluster health, along with details on all the components and resources.
children.title: Kubernetes - Cluster

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_node_status_condition condition=Ready status="true"| quantize to {{quantization_interval}} | sum by node | sum | timeshift -2m
cluster={{cluster}}   metric=kube_node_status_condition condition=Ready !status="true" | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} using max | sum | timeshift -2m
cluster={{cluster}} metric=kube_pod_status_phase phase=Running | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} using max drop last | sum
cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_pod_status_phase phase=Failed| quantize to {{quantization_interval}} using max drop last | sum
cluster={{cluster}} metric=node_cpu_seconds_total mode=idle | rate | avg | eval 1 - _value | eval _value*100 | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} drop last
cluster={{cluster}} metric=node_cpu_seconds_total mode=idle node=* | rate | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} | avg by node | eval 1 - _value | eval _value*100 | topk(500,avg)
#B * 100 along node
1 - #B / #C along cluster | avg | eval _value * 100 | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} drop last
cluster={{cluster}} metric=node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes | sum by cluster | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} drop last
cluster={{cluster}} metric=node_memory_MemTotal_bytes | sum by cluster | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} drop last
1 - #B / #C | eval _value * 100 | avg | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} drop last
cluster={{cluster}} metric=node_filesystem_avail_bytes !fstype=tmpfs node=* | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} | sum by node
cluster={{cluster}} metric=node_filesystem_size_bytes !fstype=tmpfs node=* | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} |  sum by node

cluster={{cluster}} (metric=node_network_receive_bytes_total OR metric=node_network_transmit_bytes_total) !device=veth* | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} using sum | rate increasing | sum | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} drop last

cluster={{cluster}} (metric=node_network_receive_drop_total OR metric=node_network_transmit_drop_total) !device=veth* | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} using sum | rate | sum | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} drop last
#E / #D * 100  | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} drop last
metric=node_cpu_seconds_total cluster={{cluster}} | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} using max drop last | count by node, cpu | sum
cluster={{cluster}} metric=node_memory_MemTotal_bytes  | eval _value / 1000000 | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} using max drop last | sum
cluster={{cluster}} metric=kube_pod_status_phase !(phase=running or phase=pending) | quantize to {{quantization_interval}} using max drop last | sum

| json field=_raw "object.reason" as reason
| json field=_raw "object.type"
| limit 100

| count by reason, cluster, kind

panels.title: Untitled
panels.text:
# What does Red Indicate?

### If one of the panels goes red, it means that Prometheus was unable to scrape from that endpoint. This will result in some set of metrics not being visible inside of Sumo Logic.

| where namespace matches "{{namespace}}"

| where name matches "{{pod}}" and kind matches "Pod"
| json  "object.lastTimestamp" as lastTimestamp
| json  "object.message" as message
| count by name, cluster, lastTimestamp, message, namespace
| sort by lastTimestamp desc
| fields - _count
| limit 100

panels.title: Rule Priorities
panels.text:
###Every Falco rule has a priority which indicates the triggered rule's severity.

###The possible set of priorities are:

   - EMERGENCY
   - ALERT
   - CRITICAL
   - ERROR
   - WARNING
   - NOTICE
   - INFORMATIONAL
   - DEBUG

###The general guidelines used to assign priorities to rules are the following:

   - If a rule is related to a write state (e.g., filesystem activity), the priority is ERROR.
   - If a rule is related to an unauthorized read state (e.g., reading sensitive files), the priority is WARNING.
   - If a rule is related to unexpected behavior (e.g., spawning an unexpected shell in a container, opening an unexpected network connection, etc.), the priority is NOTICE.
   - If a rule is related to behaving against good practices (e.g., unexpected privileged containers, containers with sensitive mounts, running interactive commands as root), the priority is INFO.
   
For more information, see the official Falco documentation at https://falco.org/docs/.

####Note: This dashboard relies on Falco. If the Dashboard is not populated, enable Falco by setting the flag "falco:enabled" as "true" in values.yaml as mentioned here: https://github.com/SumoLogic/sumologic-kubernetes-collection/blob/master/deploy/docs/Installation_with_Helm.md
